blog.description: Hi, my name is Jen, I'm 28 years old and books have taken over my life.

summary: Tower of Dawn || Sarah J. Maas || Throne of Glass #6 || 672 pages...
caption:
Tower of Dawn || Sarah J. Maas || Throne of Glass #6 || 672 pages
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Top 3 Genres: Fantasy / Young Adult / Romance

Synopsis: Chaol Westfall has always defined himself by his unwavering loyalty, his strength, and his position as the Captain of the Guard. But all of that has changed since the glass castle shattered, since his men were slaughtered, since the King of Adarlan spared him from a killing blow, but left his body broken.

His only shot at recovery lies with the legendary healers of the Torre Cesme in Antica—the stronghold of the southern continent’s mighty empire. And with war looming over Dorian and Aelin back home, their survival might lie with Chaol and Nesryn convincing its rulers to ally with them.

But what they discover in Antica will change them both—and be more vital to saving Erilea than they could have imagined.

Started: December 21st, 2018.

tags: a court of mist and fury
a court of frost and starlight
summary:
Happy Birthday, Feyre Darling!
I am aware of the fact that people keep comparing Feyre and Aelin, — and in those comparisons...
body:
Happy Birthday, Feyre Darling!

I am aware of the fact that people keep comparing Feyre and Aelin, — and in those comparisons Aelin always wins, — but here is the thing: Aelin and Feyre are two completely different people and are iconic in their own way.

The High Lady of The Night Court, is a badass bombshell and utterly inspirational. — Not to forget the fact that Feyre has one of the most interesting and emotional character development we all have read about *looks at ACOMAF with affectionate eyes*

So, here’s to Feyre the Cauldron Blessed!

[And happy Winter Solstice to everyone!]

Art Credits: @shalizeh7

blog.name: softlysaygoodbye
blog.title: My disorders are going to lose
blog.description: Welcome to my personal blog. I mainly post mental health and artsy things. I am an author, aspiring actress/musician, and public speaker. I am a twice published poet. Regarding education, I have acheived my High School Diploma, my Associates' Degree in Liberal Arts, and am graduating in May 2019 with my Bachelor's Degree in English. I am 20, and I DO NOT PROMOTE SUICIDE OR ANYTHING LIKE IT. THIS IS MY WAY OF VENTING & HELPING PEOPLE REALIZE THAT THEY ARE NOT ALONE IN THIS. I also do not own anything that isn't labeled with my url, myriah i. starrs, or myriah Iceillia starrs. (Trigger Warning)  Also, feel free to follow me on my other social media accounts. I love hearing from people. Pro-recovery blog. Recovering OSFED, Self-injury, Addict, Bipolar Disorder II, Anxiety, dissociative episodes, promiscuity, and suicidal ideation/near attempts. All types of abuse and bullying survivor. Former Seventh-day Adventist (cult survivor).

tags: a court of mist and fury
a court of frost and starlight
summary: To Everyone who hates Morrigan and loves Nesta:
body:
To Everyone who hates Morrigan and loves Nesta:

About Nesta:

  • Nesta let her baby sister, Feyre, out into the jungle to hunt, where Feyre could have died — which she did, — while Nesta sat in the cottage holding onto her fragile pride. No explanation can ever justify that!
  • Nesta, as an elder sister, never spared Feyre enough time to teach her how to read, which also got Feyre nearly killed.
  • Nesta treats everyone, including herself, like shit!
  • Morrigan tried to befriend Nesta the very first time. — When Nesta came to have a dinner with The Court Of Dreams the first time in ACOWAR. And what did Nesta do? She insulted Mor.

About Morrigan:

  • Morrigan broke into enemy territory to rescue a girl she barely knew.
  • Morrigan befriended a broken girl and helped her into molding herself back and becoming a bigger and better person, with no expectations.
  • Morrigan treats people like humans should be treated. — Unless they get on a wrong footing with her. (i.e. like Eris.)
  • Morrigan repeatedly drops hints for both Azriel and Cassian to take the clue that she is not interested in having a romantic relationship with them. — She literally nailed Helion just to prove a point to Az. How is that leading on?

To the people saying Mor comes between Nessian:

  • I am sorry, I don’t understand you guys. — Nesta is in a bad place and isn’t ready to acknowledge her feelings for Cassian.
  • When Nesta treats Cassian like shit, he turns to Morrigan for some harmless flirting.
  • Morrigan never initiates any sort of flirting. n e v e r.
  • If Morrigan wanted to get between Nesta and Cassian, she wouldn’t let Feyre tell Cassian to take Nesta to the illyrian mountains. — She would have stopped her.
  • And if my best friend was also falling for a person who treated them like Nesta treats Cassian, I would be very wary and skeptical about it too.

Stop talking shit about Morrigan. She is a Queen, who actually cares about people and their feelings!

Side note: The point of this post is not to hate on Nesta.

tags: a court of thorns and roses
summary: This may be an unpopular opinion, but . . .
body:
This may be an unpopular opinion, but …

When the ACOTAR’s movie comes out, I want it to show 1.) Feylin happy and in love.

2.) No sexual tension between Rhysand and Feyre.

(This is just for ACOTAR, not any of the rest of the series)


1.) I completely hated Tamlin by the end of the series, and I still do. But I want the movie to show how he’s human (not literally). I want them to show his development being under the mountain caused. Before that, he and Feyre had feelings for each other. I don’t want Tamlin portrayed as someone everyone (who hasn’t read the books) can’t tell is going to be abusive. I want it to be realistic in that you can’t tell someone is going to be an abuser. Now this may just be my opinion, but I want Tamlin showed as a man who truly loved Feyre and how being underneath the mountain made him abusive and overbearing. At the same time, I don’t want his abuse of Feyre romanticized. I don’t want people to be like ‘oh he loves her and went through some things, so it’s not abuse’. Because it is.


2.) I love Feysand. Don’t get me wrong … but Feyre hated Rhysand at first and she loved Tamlin. I don’t want the movie to show that Feyre secretly wanted him, because it was Tamlin’s love she went down there for. I don’t want young people to watch this and think that’s Feyre didn’t hate him because ‘she’s a woman and they are fickle’ or ‘women don’t really mean it when they don’t like a guy’. I don’t want boys to watch this and think ‘oh if a girl says she hates me she doesn’t mean it. It’s just sexual tension and she wants me’. In the beginning, Feyre loved Tamlin and didn’t like Rhysand, so I don’t want her and Rhysand having an affair or anything like that.

I don’t want Tamlin portrayed as someone everyone (who hasn’t read the books) can’t tell is going to be abusive. I want it to be realistic in that you can’t tell someone is going to be an abuser. Now this may just be my opinion, but I want Tamlin showed as a man who truly loved Feyre and how being underneath the mountain made him abusive and overbearing. At the same time, I don’t want his abuse of Feyre romanticized. I don’t want people to be like ‘oh he loves her and went through some things, so it’s not abuse’. Because it is.


2.) I love Feysand. Don’t get me wrong … but Feyre hated Rhysand at first and she loved Tamlin. I don’t want the movie to show that Feyre secretly wanted him, because it was Tamlin’s love she went down there for. I don’t want young people to watch this and think that’s Feyre didn’t hate him because ‘she’s a woman and they are fickle’ or ‘women don’t really mean it when they don’t like a guy’. I don’t want boys to watch this and think ‘oh if a girl says she hates me she doesn’t mean it. It’s just sexual tension and she wants me’. In the beginning, Feyre loved Tamlin and didn’t like Rhysand, so I don’t want her and Rhysand having an affair or anything like that.
